intro: Hookera subbiflora, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand harsh mountain climates. Hookera subbiflora plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to alpine biodiversity.
